metadata.title: RZ/N2L: What input voltage is acceptable for VCC1833?

sections.content:
Question:
What input voltage is acceptable for VCC1833?
Answer:
The RZ/N2L has five independent power supply domains (VCC1833_0 to VCC1833_4) for the Ethernet interfaces and xSPI interfaces, and you can supply voltages separately for each of the domains. 
Ethernet interfaces (target power supply domains: VCC1833_0, VCC1833_1, and VCC1833_2)
The supply voltage differs depending on the interface to be used for the connection with the PHY. 
RGMII: 1.8 V
RMII/MII: 3.3 V
Please be careful because voltages other than the above are not supported.

xSPI interfaces (target power supply domains: VCC1833_3 and VCC1833_4)
You can supply 1.8 V or 3.3 V for connections with external devices, but the maximum operating frequency differs depending on the selected voltage.
For 1.8 V: 133 MHz (SDR), 100 MHz (DDR)
For 3.3 V: 75 MHz (SDR, DDR)
Note: In case of the 121-pin package, VCC1833_0, VCC1833_3, and VCC1833_4 must be fixed to 3.3 V.
Suitable Products
RZ/N2L
